task.title: Creating a basic authentication security definition
task.shortdesc: Create a basic authentication security definition to specify the authentication URL or LDAP user registry to authenticate accesses to APIs.

context.p:
You can authenticate users with an authentication URL or an LDAP registry.
When you use an authentication URL, the sends the credentials that it collects from the API client to the endpoint that is specified in the URL for validation. When the user is authenticated, the authentication URL returns an HTTP 200 OK response status code. All other HTTP response status codes result in an authentication failure and the access is denied.
When you use an LDAP registry, the uses an LDAP server to authenticate the API client.

step.cmd: From the search results, select API Security Basic Authentication.
When you authenticate users with an authentication URL, complete the following steps.

substep.cmd: Enter the URL to validate client credentials.
Select the SSL client profile to secure connections between the and the authentication server.

step.cmd: When you authenticate users with an LDAP registry, select the name of the API LDAP Registry configuration to authenticate the API request.

taskbody.postreq: To enforce the security scheme, add the basic authentication security definition into a security requirement of an API or operation.
